Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian ( or Samian?) Late Wild Goat Style pottery plate; pale grey fabric core sandwiched between salmon coloured margins; white slip; interior: black band at edge of low, upturned rim; inside, wide wavy black band, band with added red band superimposed, dilute band and further band with added red; in tondo lotus bud and dots; exterior: black band around rim, four narrow bands at top of wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Modern inscription written in ink 'NAU 10' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 80, NAU10), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in North Ionia or possibly Samos.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78, 82-83, fig. 1) (NAU 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.709)
